title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge ruled that Shannon O'Brien must be reinstated as chair of the Cannabis Control Commission, but the state appealed.
State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg cited 'gross misconduct' for firing O'Brien in 2024, but a judge found the removal unjustified.
The decision to reinstate O'Brien is stayed for a week pending further legal responses and a judge's ruling on the appeal.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday morning.
A 30-year-old Lynn man has been arrested and charged with her murder.
The suspect is set to be arraigned Monday morning in Lynn District Court.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers expressed contentment with being a Raider despite requesting a trade from Las Vegas.
Meyers caught eight passes for 97 yards in a 20-13 win against his former team, the Patriots.
Meyers joined the Raiders with a 3-year, $33 million contract after leaving the Patriots in 2023.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A tornado was confirmed in Holden, Massachusetts, during a severe storm over the weekend, causing some damage Saturday.
The National Weather Service postponed the tornado damage survey to Monday due to ongoing weather conditions.
Severe thunderstorms affected the entire East Coast, with tornado warnings issued across parts of Massachusetts, including Worcester and Springfield.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The 2025 Patriots lost their season opener 20-13 to the Las Vegas Raiders at home.
Drake Maye threw a promising first half but struggled in the second with just 51 yards and an interception.
New defensive additions showed potential, but the Patriots allowed nine plays of 20+ yards, exposing defensive weaknesses.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie Will Campbell struggled late with penalties and allowing sacks in the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel called Campbell's NFL debut inconsistent but noted he'll provide a detailed review after watching the tape.
Defensive player Maxx Crosby praised Campbell's potential, emphasizing support from Patriots coach Josh McDaniels.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer is on leave after appearing incapacitated during a traffic stop, as shown in social media videos.
The Lynn Police Department stated that the officer's condition seemed to be a medical episode, not drug or alcohol related.
An investigation is underway, with the officer placed on administrative leave while potential contributing factors are examined.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lose to Raiders 20-13 in season opener under Coach Mike Vrabel at Gillette Stadium.
Harold Landry shined defensively with 2.5 sacks, while Kayshon Boutte led receiving with multiple catches and yards.
The Patriots' running game struggled, totaling only 60 yards, while kicker Andy Borregales missed a crucial field goal.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys performed at the Seisiún festival in Boston after a two-hour rain delay at Suffolk Downs.
The band's set included songs like 'The Boys Are Back,' crowd favorite 'I'm Shipping Up To Boston,' and a tribute to Shane McGowan.
Despite weather challenges and a reduced audience, attendees described the performance as energetic and community-focused.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick confirmed he banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices citing unwelcome treatment at the facility.
Belichick's decision fuels ongoing tensions with Patriots, rooted in his 2023 departure as head coach.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel acknowledged the ban, emphasizing focus on their team and alternative scouting methods.
